file_summary: This configuration file, likely `application.properties`, sets up various core aspects of a Spring Boot application. It configures an H2 in-memory database, specifying the locations for schema and data initialization scripts. It also defines web-related settings, such as setting Thymeleaf's template mode to HTML. JPA (Java Persistence API) settings are configured to prevent automatic DDL generation by Hibernate and disable the 'open-in-view' pattern. Internationalization is enabled by setting the base name for message bundles. Furthermore, it exposes all Spring Boot Actuator web endpoints for monitoring and management, sets the default logging level for Spring components to INFO, and defines a maximum cache age of 12 hours for static web resources to optimize performance.
